(Lakhipur - As per report submitted by Goalpara West-Jaleswar WR Sub Division, due to sudden change of river configuration and heavy rainfall, damages has been observed at B/Dyke of Takimari area for a reach length of about 500.00 m and B/Dyke of Nichinpur area  for a reach length of about 1000.00 m dated 29/08/2025)

(Dergaon - Due to heavy rainfall in previous days, water level of Saraipani river alongwith Kakodonga river have been risen and thus excess water is stagnant at crop field at present dated 11th Sept. 2025)
(Kadam - As per the report received from concerned Gaon Pradhan on 05-09-2025), (Narayanpur - As per Report from Bihpuria ESD 6 nos of Pole and 2.98 KM of conductor damaged on dated 15/09/2025)

(Kaliabor - 1. PHE Department distributed 2,100 liters of drinking water at the Salona Bapuji LP School Relief Camp.
2. Hot cooked meals were distributed to 21 families at the Salona Bapuji LP School Relief Camp., 1. PHE Department distributed 1600 liters of drinking water at Kalapani village.
2. Due to the continuous heavy rainfall in the last couple of days, A 3 km stretch of Road from NH 715 to Dijubasti village have been flooded by the overflowing Diju River. Report submitted by  Assistant Executive Engineer , PWRD, Kaliabor Territorial Road Sub-Division, Jakhalabandha Date 19-09-2025., 1. PHE Department distributed 1600 liters of Drinking water at Flood affected villages.), (Samaguri - 5 Nos of Temporary Bathroom constructed for flood affected people.)
